stories.original_title: MaliciousCorgi: AI Extensions send your code to China
stories.generated_headline: Malicious AI Code Assistants Exfiltrate Source Code to China
stories.summary: Two VS Code extensions, ChatGPT - 中文版 and ChatMoss, with 1.5 million combined installs, secretly harvest and transmit developers' source code to servers in China, exploiting trust in AI-powered coding tools.

stories.original_title: Actors: A Model of Concurrent Computation [pdf] (1985)
stories.generated_headline: Pioneering Concurrency: The Actor Model's Enduring Influence on Computation
stories.summary: Carl Hewitt's seminal 1985 paper introduced the Actor model, a revolutionary approach to concurrent computation that has shaped the development of modern programming languages and systems. This foundational work continues to influence research and innovation in the field.

stories.original_title: Claude Code is suddenly everywhere inside Microsoft
stories.generated_headline: Microsoft Integrates Anthropic's Claude Model into Core Products, Redefining AI Strategy
stories.summary: Microsoft has rapidly deployed Anthropic's Claude model across its product lineup, signaling a major shift in its AI development approach and challenging existing partnerships.

stories.original_title: Are we dismissing AI spend before the 6x lands? (2025)
stories.generated_headline: Ramping Up for AI's Transformative Leap: Are Enterprises Prepared for 6x Computational Power?
stories.summary: As AI capabilities accelerate, industry leaders are questioning whether current investments will suffice to harness the impending 6x increase in computational power, potentially revolutionizing industries and redefining technological boundaries.

stories.original_title: Towards a science of scaling agent systems: When and why agent systems work
stories.generated_headline: Unlocking the Secrets of Scalable Agent Systems: A Scientific Approach
stories.summary: Researchers explore the fundamental principles behind the success of agent systems, shedding light on when and why these systems work. This breakthrough could pave the way for more efficient and effective AI applications.

stories.original_title: Clearspace (YC W23) Is Hiring an Applied Researcher (ML)
stories.generated_headline: Breakthroughs in Machine Learning Drive Clearspace's Research Hiring Surge
stories.summary: Clearspace, a Y Combinator-backed startup, is seeking an Applied Researcher to further develop its machine learning capabilities, signaling a significant push in the field. This role highlights the growing demand for innovative AI solutions.

stories.original_title: My fast zero-allocation webserver using OxCaml
stories.generated_headline: OxCaml Web Server Achieves Zero-Allocation Performance Milestone
stories.summary: A developer showcases a high-performance web server built with OxCaml, pushing the boundaries of speed and efficiency in web development.

stories.original_title: Nano-vLLM: How a vLLM-style inference engine works
stories.generated_headline: Unlocking Efficiency: Nano-vLLM Revolutionizes Language Model Inference
stories.summary: Nano-vLLM introduces a cutting-edge inference engine that optimizes performance and scalability for large language models, transforming the future of AI applications.

stories.original_title: "Solving" Wordle from Shared Scores at 100%* Accuracy
stories.generated_headline: Researchers Achieve Perfect Accuracy in Retrospectively Solving Wordle Puzzles from Opponent Score Shares
stories.summary: A new study demonstrates a method to reverse-engineer Wordle solutions with 100% accuracy using only shared score data, raising questions about the game's security and potential countermeasures.

stories.original_title: Show HN: NanoClaw – “Clawdbot” in 500 lines of TS with Apple container isolation
stories.generated_headline: Breakthrough in Compact Robotics: NanoClaw Redefines Autonomous Manipulation with Minimalist Codebase
stories.summary: NanoClaw, a 500-line TypeScript project, leverages Apple container isolation to create a remarkably compact yet capable robotic system, pushing the boundaries of what's possible in resource-constrained environments.

stories.original_title: My iPhone 16 Pro Max produces garbage output when running MLX LLMs
stories.generated_headline: iPhone 16 Pro Max Struggles with MLX LLM Output Quality
stories.summary: A user's experience with running MLX LLMs on their iPhone 16 Pro Max resulted in subpar output, raising questions about the device's capabilities for local language model processing.

stories.original_title: Two kinds of AI users are emerging
stories.generated_headline: The Great Divide: Two Distinct Profiles of Artificial Intelligence Users Take Shape
stories.summary: As AI adoption accelerates, experts identify emerging dichotomies in user behavior, with some leveraging AI as a creative partner and others relying on it as an automated solution.

stories.original_title: 1-Click RCE to steal your Moltbot data and keys
stories.generated_headline: Moltbot Data Vulnerability Exposes Users to Remote Code Execution Attacks
stories.summary: A critical vulnerability in Moltbot allows attackers to steal sensitive data and keys through a single click, highlighting the need for robust security measures. The exploit's simplicity raises concerns about the potential for widespread attacks.

stories.original_title: Microsoft is walking back Windows 11's AI overload
stories.generated_headline: Microsoft Reverses Course on AI-Driven Windows 11 Features Amid User Backlash
stories.summary: Microsoft is scaling back its AI-powered features in Windows 11, including Recall, due to user concerns over privacy and usability. The move marks a significant shift in the company's AI-first approach to its flagship operating system.

stories.original_title: MRI scans show exercise can make the brain look younger
stories.generated_headline: Exercise Linked to Younger-Looking Brain Structure in Adults
stories.summary: A new study using MRI scans reveals that regular exercise can contribute to a more youthful brain structure in adults, potentially combating age-related cognitive decline.
